description: Non-material amendments as follows:Ground Floor level   Fire door removed from NW09 lobby    Substation re-orientated    GP cycle store moved    Vehicle gates moved back    Facade of bike hub adjusted    Solid Panels removed to curtain walling    Air lock front door moved out  First Floor level  Opening doors with Juliet removed Level 11 Floor Plan and Level 21 Roof Plan  Extent of Plant at roof level increased   To elevations   Pattern added to GP surgery fa‡ade   Door locations amended   Laminated glass panel replaced with aluminium panel    Parapet to roofs at level 21 raised from 1100m to 1700mm AFFL  Height of plant at roof level increased    All metal bands across spandrel panel removed   Window heads raised by 150mm   Brickwork raised by 150mm   Glazing pattern amended to smaller panes   Opaque glass replaced with transparent glass   Amenity link brickwork changed to brick type 2 (dark)   Canopy added to NW09 entrance   Amenity link south facade changed to brickwork    Patterned brick changed to corbelled brickwork    Automatic opening full height window vent to corridors replaced with AOV glazed louvre   To landscaping  Minor changes to Port Cochere highway kerb and access arrangement    Addition of raised planters added to Wellers Way   Relocation of Communal outdoor BBQ and kitchen area    Natural turf added to the central area    Area of artificial lawn amended at Level 11 terraces    Re-configuration of private terraces at Level 11  of Reserved matters application ref. 18/4422 dated 19 February, 2019, in relation to Plot NW09/10 comprising the construction of three buildings, ranging from 7 to 21 storeys in height, providing 396 residential units (within the private rented and discount market rented tenures) with private communal residential landscaped gardens, car parking spaces for residential use; commercial space for either Class A1 or A2 (Retail), A3 (Caf‚ and Restaurant), and/or A4 (Drinking establishments); a Health Centre (Use Class D1) as well as associated plant, cycle storage, refuse provision, other residential ancillary space and associated infrastructure including a new estate road connecting to Fulton Road. The reserved matters application was submitted pursuant to conditions 1 (Layout, Scale, Appearance, Access, and Landscaping); 19 (d) Cycle Storage; 19 (e) Motor Cycle and Car Park Provision; 19 (f): Details of Electric Vehicle Charging Points; 19 (h): Wind; 19 (k) Internal layout of buildings; 19(l) Access; 19(m) Daylight; 19(n) Private external space; 29 Playspace; 30 Wheelchair Accessible Accommodation; 38 Air Quality;  48 GLA Standards; 49 Phasing Plan(see 18/2214 for full description of Wembley Park Masterplan development)
site_name: Land to the South of Fulton Road, east of Harbutt Road and north of Humphry Repton Lane (Plot NW09/10), Wembley
